content:
DataGridViewLinkColumn Class

Definition

Represents a column of cells that contain links in a DataGridView control.

In this Article

[System.Drawing.ToolboxBitmap(typeof(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn), "DataGridViewLinkColumn.bmp")]
public class DataGridViewLinkColumn : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn
Inheritance
Object
DataGridViewElement
DataGridViewBand
System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn
DataGridViewLinkColumn

State

Remarks

The DataGridViewLinkColumn class is a specialized type of the DataGridViewColumn class used to logically host cells that respond to user clicks. The DataGridViewLinkColumn class is similar to the DataGridViewButtonColumn class but provides a different user experience that may be more appropriate in certain situations, such as displaying a URL stored in a database table.

To display the same link text for every cell, set the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property to true and set the Text property to the desired link text.

A DataGridViewLinkColumn has an associated DataGridViewLinkCell in every DataGridViewRow that intersects it.

The default sort mode for this column type is DataGridViewColumnSortMode.

To respond to user link clicks, handle the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellContentClick event. You can also use the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellClick event to respond to clicks anywhere in the cell.

Constructors

DataGridViewLinkColumn()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewLinkColumn class.

public DataGridViewLinkColumn ();

Remarks

When initializing a new DataGridViewLinkColumn instance, this constructor sets the CellTemplate property to a new DataGridViewLinkCell instance.

Properties

ActiveLinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display an active link within cells in the column.

public System.Drawing.Color ActiveLinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to display a link that is being selected. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the color of links in the hover state.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the ActiveLinkColor property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the ActiveLinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

CellTemplate

Gets or sets the template used to create new cells.

public override System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell CellTemplate { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewCell

A DataGridViewCell that all other cells in the column are modeled after. The default value is a new DataGridViewLinkCell instance.

Exceptions
InvalidCastException

When setting this property to a value that is not of type DataGridViewLinkCell.

Remarks

The constructor for the DataGridViewLinkColumn class initializes this property to a newly created DataGridViewLinkCell.

Caution

Changing the properties of the cell template will not immediately affect the user interface (UI) of the column's existing cells. These changes are only apparent after the column is regenerated (for example, by sorting the column or through a call to the InvalidateColumn method).

LinkBehavior

Gets or sets a value that represents the behavior of links within cells in the column.

public System.Windows.Forms.LinkBehavior LinkBehavior { get; set; }
Value
LinkBehavior

A LinkBehavior value indicating the link behavior. The default is LinkBehavior.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the LinkBehavior property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the LinkBehavior property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

LinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display an unselected link within cells in the column.

public System.Drawing.Color LinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to initially display a link. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the link color.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the LinkColor property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the LinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Text

Gets or sets the link text displayed in a column's cells if stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.UseColumnTextForLinkValue* is true.

public string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

A String containing the link text.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

When setting this property, the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

The text is visible if the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property is set to true. Otherwise, each cell's link text is populated with the FormattedValue property of each cell.

You can override the Text property value for individual cells by setting the cell UseColumnTextForLinkValue property to false after setting the column UseColumnTextForLinkValue property to true.

TrackVisitedState

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link changes color if it has been visited.

public bool TrackVisitedState { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the link changes color when it is selected; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

When TrackVisitedState is true, the VisitedLinkColor property value is used to display links that have already been visited.

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the TrackVisitedState property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the TrackVisitedState property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

UseColumnTextForLinkValue

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text* property value is displayed as the link text.

public bool UseColumnTextForLinkValue { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text* property value is displayed as the link text; false if the cell stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue* property value is displayed as the link text. The default is false.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

VisitedLinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display a link that has been previously visited.

public System.Drawing.Color VisitedLinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to display a link that has been visited. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the visited link color.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

If the TrackVisitedState property is set to false, the VisitedLinkColor property is ignored.

Getting or setting this property gets or sets the VisitedLinkColor property of the object returned by the CellTemplate property. Setting this property also sets the VisitedLinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Methods

Clone()

Creates an exact copy of this column.

public override object Clone ();
Returns
Object

An Object that represents the cloned DataGridViewLinkColumn.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate* property is null.

Remarks

Use this method to duplicate a column of link cells.

ToString()

Gets a string that describes the column.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A String that describes the column.
